intro: Pogostemon aquaticus, commonly known as water mint, is a perennial herb native to wetland environments in Asia. It features square, erect stems that are often hairy and can grow up to 1 meter in height. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers in whorled clusters, which bloom from summer to autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped, aromatic, and have a mint-like scent when crushed. Pogostemon aquaticus thrives in moist soils and is often found in marshes, stream sides, and ponds.
